title: Tensor size mismatch when altering yolov3-tiny.yaml structure
body: I want to remove a few layers from the yolov3-tiny.yaml structure and was following the comment [here](https://github.com/pjreddie/darknet/issues/363#issuecomment-350231713). However, I'm getting the following error: ``` Traceback (most recent call last): File "train.py", line 578, in train(hyp, opt, device, tb_writer, wandb) File "train.py", line 95, in train model = Model(opt.cfg or ckpt['model'].yaml, ch=3, nc=nc).to(device) # create File "/models/yolo.py", line 89, in __init__ m.stride = torch.tensor([s / x.shape[-2] for x in self.forward(torch.zeros(1, ch, s, s))]) # forward File "/models/yolo.py", line 119, in forward return self.forward_once(x, profile) # single-scale inference, train File "/models/yolo.py", line 135, in forward_once x = m(x) # run File "/python3.6/site-packages/torch/nn/modules/module.py", line 889, in _call_impl result = self.forward(*input, **kwargs) File "/models/common.py", line 151, in forward return torch.cat(x, self.d) RuntimeError: Sizes of tensors must match except in dimension 1. Got 18 and 16 in dimension 2 (The offending index is 1) ``` The change I had made to the yolov3-tiny.yaml structure is as follows I've gone through previous issues related to this one but those were for the older format of the cfg files. Are there any other places where I am supposed to make changes as well when altering the network structure of the cfg files?
